StrategicNumber.description: Strategic numbers for controling the behavior of the AI.

values.name: sn-percent-civilian-explorers
values.notes: Controls the normal, formula-based percentage of civilian explorers allocated.

values.name: sn-percent-civilian-builders
values.notes: Controls the normal, formula-based percentage of builders allocated.

values.name: sn-percent-civilian-gatherers
values.notes: Controls the normal, formula-based percentage of gatherers allocated.

values.name: sn-cap-civilian-explorers
values.notes: Caps the number of civilian explorers allocated. Factored in after the percentage is calculated. Ignored when set to -1.

values.name: sn-cap-civilian-builders
values.available: available, however it must be at least 6-7 at all times, 10 if you will build walls, and 40-50 for wonder construction (100+ is recommended)
values.notes: Caps the number of builders allocated. Factored in after the percentage is calculated. Ignored when set to -1, causing all construction to be blocked.

values.name: sn-cap-civilian-gatherers
values.notes: Caps the number of gatherers allocated. Factored in after the percentage is calculated. Ignored when set to -1.

values.name: sn-minimum-attack-group-size
values.notes: Sets the minimum size of land-based attack groups. A group must meet its minimum size as one of the tasking prerequisites. The game can change this itself during the game.

values.name: sn-total-number-explorers
values.notes: Caps the total number of land explorers allocated. Factored in after the percentage of civilian explorers is calculated and the soldier groups are set up. Ignored when set to -1.

values.name: sn-percent-enemy-sighted-response
values.notes: Sets the percentage of idle troops that will respond to another unit being attacked.

values.name: sn-enemy-sighted-response-distance
values.notes: Sets the distance inside of which units will be candidates for response to an enemy attack.

values.name: sn-sentry-distance
values.notes: Sets the distance at which the town is defended.

values.name: sn-relic-return-distance
values.notes: Sets the distance that relics must be within to be considered returned to the Town Center.

values.name: sn-percent-victory-clamp
values.available: seems available, except for when teams-locked is disabled

values.name: sn-minimum-defend-group-size
values.notes: Sets the minimum size of land-based defend groups. A group must meet its minimum size as one of the tasking prerequisites.

values.name: sn-maximum-attack-group-size
values.notes: Sets the maximum size of land-based attack groups.

values.name: sn-maximum-defend-group-size
values.notes: Sets the maximum size of land-based defend groups.

values.name: sn-minimum-peace-like-level
values.notes: Sets the level at which computer players must like another player before allying with that player.

values.name: sn-percent-health-retreat
values.available: available, but avoid using it in conjunction with sn-scale-percent-health-retreat (95)
values.notes: Sets the percentage of hit points that a group can lose (relative to what it started the attack with) before retreating. Must be >= 1 and <= 100.

values.name: sn-percent-death-retreat
values.available: available, but avoid using it in conjunction with sn-scale-percent-death-retreat (96)
values.notes: Sets the percentage of units that a group can let die (relative to what it started the attack with) before retreating. Must be >= 1 and <= 100.

values.name: sn-percent-exploration-required
values.notes: Sets the minimum amount of exploration that a computer player must have accomplished before being allowed to retask civilian explorers.

values.name: sn-zero-priority-distance
values.notes: Sets the distance at which a computer player's order for a unit is set to a priority of 0.

values.name: sn-minimum-civilian-explorers
values.notes: Sets a minimum number of civilian explorers.

values.name: sn-number-attack-groups
values.notes: Sets the desired number of land-based attack groups. Sn-percent-attack-soldiers generally works better.

values.name: sn-attack-group-makeup
values.available: seems available

values.name: sn-number-defend-groups
values.notes: Sets the desired number of land-based defend groups.

values.name: sn-group-fill-method
values.available: seems available
values.notes: Sets the method by which a computer player fills a group of units. There are two concepts here: single group fill and level group fill. In single group fill, all available units are put into the first non-minimally full group. Once that group is full, the next group is entirely filled before the third group is considered. In level group fill, all groups are filled at the same time (one unit is placed in the first group, the next in the second, etc.). The single group fill fills up to the minimum in each group, then goes to the level group fill. Both methods respect the maximum group sizes. 0 keys the single group fill, and 1 keys the level group fill. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-attack-group-gather-spacing
values.notes: Controls the relative proximity (to the group gather point) that grouped units must be in before the group is considered gathered.

values.name: sn-number-explore-groups
values.notes: Sets the desired number of land-based soldier exploration groups.

values.name: sn-minimum-explore-group-size
values.notes: Sets the minimum size of land-based soldier exploration groups. A group must meet its minimum size as one of the tasking prerequisites.

values.name: sn-maximum-explore-group-size
values.notes: Sets the maximum size of land-based soldier exploration groups.

values.name: sn-attack-separation-time
values.available: seems available, but leave it for later
values.notes: Sets the amount of time that must pass between computer player attacks. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-attack-coordination
values.available: seems available, but leave it for later
values.notes: Selects the type of coordination between computer player attacks. 0 means no coordination. 1 means that one group may attack at a time. 2 means that multiple groups may attack at the same time. Must be >= 0 and <= 2.

values.name: sn-attack-response-separation-time
values.available: seems available, but leave it for later
values.notes: Sets the amount of time that must pass before units respond to a subsequent enemy attack distress call. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-retreat-after-target-destroyed
values.available: seems available, but leave it for later
values.notes: Selects what happens when a target is destroyed during an attack. 0 means that the attack group will never retreat and will recenter upon their current position. 1 means that the group will retreat if no other target is reachable. 2 means that the group will always retreat when the target is destroyed. 3 means that the group will go into extermination mode; they will explore unexplored territory and attack any enemies units they uncover. Must be >= 0 and <= 3.

values.name: sn-gold-defend-priority
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending gold. A priority of 0 means that gold will not be defended. A priority of 1 means that gold has the highest defend priority.

values.name: sn-stone-defend-priority
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending stone.

values.name: sn-forage-defend-priority
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending forage sites.

values.name: sn-choke-point-defend-priority
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending choke points.

values.name: sn-ruins-defend-priority
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending ruins.

values.name: sn-relic-defend-priority
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending relic carts.

values.name: sn-town-defend-priority
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending the computer player's town.

values.name: sn-defense-distance
values.notes: Sets the distance at which items (town excluded) are defended.

values.name: sn-number-boat-attack-groups
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the desired number of boat attack groups. Setting sn-percent-attack-boat usually works better.

values.name: sn-minimum-boat-attack-group-size
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the minimum size of boat attack groups. A group must meet its minimum size as one of the tasking prerequisites.

values.name: sn-maximum-boat-attack-group-size
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the maximum size of boat attack groups.

values.name: sn-number-boat-explore-groups
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the desired number of military boat exploration groups. This is not affected by sn-total-number-explorers.

values.name: sn-minimum-boat-explore-group-size
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the minimum size of boat exploration groups.

values.name: sn-maximum-boat-explore-group-size
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the maximum size of boat exploration groups.

values.name: sn-desired-number-trade-escorts
values.notes: Sets the desired number of warboat escorts for tradeboats. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-desired-number-fish-escorts
values.notes: Sets the desired number of warboat escorts for fishing boats. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-desired-number-transport-escorts
values.notes: Sets the desired number of warboat escorts for transports. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-number-boat-defend-groups
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the desired number of boat defend groups.

values.name: sn-minimum-boat-defend-group-size
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the minimum size of boat defend groups.

values.name: sn-maximum-boat-defend-group-size
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the maximum size of boat defend groups.

values.name: sn-dock-defend-priority
values.available: available, except for water maps
values.notes: Sets the priority of defending the dock.

values.name: sn-lock-attack-and-attack-response
values.available: seems available
values.notes: This treats the sn-attack-separation-time and sn-attack-response-separation-time as the same numbers. Must be either 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-sentry-distance-variation
values.notes: Sets the amount of allowable variation in the defense distances.

values.name: sn-minimum-town-size
values.notes: Sets the minimum size of a computer player town.

values.name: sn-maximum-town-size
values.notes: Sets the maximum size of a computer player town.

values.name: sn-group-commander-selection-method
values.notes: Sets the method by which group commanders are selected. 0 selects the unit with the most hit points. 1 selects the unit with the fewest hit points. 2 selects the unit with the most range. The commander is set once during a group's creation and is only reset when the commander dies.

values.name: sn-consecutive-idle-unit-limit
values.available: available, but only before militarization
values.notes: Sets the number of consecutive seconds that pass before a group is set to idle if all of its units are idle. This is only used during attack and retreat phases.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-distance
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the distance rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-hitpoints
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the hit point rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-damage-capability
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the damage capability rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-kills
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the kill rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-ally-proximity
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the ally proximity (number of allies in range) rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-rof
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the rate of fire rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-randomness
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the randomness factor in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-number-wall-gates
values.available: seems available, if you will not build walls
values.notes: Sets the number of gates that must be left in the wall around a computer player's town. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-size-wall-gates
values.notes: Sets the size (in tiles) of the gates in the wall around a computer player's town. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-camp-max-distance
values.notes: Sets the maximum distance that lumber camps and mining camps may be placed from a Town Center.

values.name: sn-mill-max-distance
values.notes: Sets the maximum distance that mills may be placed from a Town Center.

values.name: sn-tactical-update-frequency
values.notes: Sets the number of seconds that pass between each tactical AI update. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-attack-attempts
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the attack attempts rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-range
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the range rating in computer player target evaluation.

values.name: sn-percent-unit-health-retreat
values.available: available, but avoid using it in conjunction with sn-scale-percent-unit-health-retreat (97)
values.notes: Sets the percentage of hit points that a unit can lose (relative to what it started the attack with) before retreating. Must be >= 1 and <= 100.

values.name: sn-defend-overlap-distance
values.notes: Sets the amount of influence that a defend group has. Defend groups will be assigned so that their circles of influence do not overlap.

values.name: sn-scale-minimum-attack-group-size
values.notes: The scaling factor for the minimum attack group size. Added to sn-minimum-attack-group-size when the tactical AI does its scaling.

values.name: sn-scale-maximum-attack-group-size
values.notes: The scaling factor for the maximum attack group size. Added to sn-minimum-attack-group-size when the tactical AI does its scaling.

values.name: sn-scale-percent-health-retreat
values.available: available, but avoid using it in conjunction with sn-percent-health-retreat (30)
values.notes: The scaling factor for the percent health retreat. Added to sn-percent-health-retreat when the tactical AI does its scaling. Must be >= -100 and <= 100.

values.name: sn-scale-percent-death-retreat
values.available: available, but avoid using it in conjunction with sn-percent-death-retreat (31)
values.notes: The scaling factor for the percent health retreat. Added to sn-percent-death-retreat when the tactical AI does its scaling. Must be >= -100 and <= 100.

values.name: sn-scale-percent-unit-health-retreat
values.available: available, but avoid using it in conjunction with sn-percent-unit-health-retreat (91)
values.notes: The scaling factor for the percent health retreat. Added to sn-percent-unit-health-retreat when the tactical AI does its scaling. Must be >= -100 and <= 100.

values.name: sn-attack-group-size-randomness
values.notes: The randomness factor in the attack group size. This sets a cap on the amount of randomness in the minimum attack group size. The randomness factor is set once (when the group is created) and will be between 0 and this number.

values.name: sn-scaling-frequency
values.notes: Sets the number of minutes that pass between each scaling inside the tactical AI.

values.name: sn-maximum-gaia-attack-response
values.notes: The maximum number of villagers that respond to another civilian getting attacked by a Gaia animal.

values.name: sn-build-frequency
values.notes: Sets the number of tactical AI updates that pass between each training or research attempt.

values.name: sn-attack-separation-time-randomness
values.available: seems available, but it would be best to avoid it
values.notes: The amount of randomness incorporated into the attack separation time. Must be >= 0 and < sn-attack-separation-time.

values.name: sn-attack-intelligence
values.notes: Specifies whether the intelligent attack system is used. The intelligent attack system tries to avoid enemy units when attacking and tries to attack from different sides. When used with the sn-attack-coordination set to 2, this can create multifront attacks. Must be 0 (to turn off) and 1 (to turn on).

values.name: sn-initial-attack-delay
values.notes: The forced, initial delay before any computer player attacks (in seconds).

values.name: sn-save-scenario-information
values.notes: Controls whether the learning information is saved at the end of the scenario for a given computer player. Must be 0 (to turn off) or 1 (to turn on).

values.name: sn-special-attack-type1
values.notes: Set to 1 to target monasteries and monks carrying relics.

values.name: sn-special-attack-type2
values.notes: Set to any unit, building, or group id to direct attacks.

values.name: sn-special-attack-type3
values.notes: Set to 1 to target wonders.

values.name: sn-special-attack-influence1
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the special attack type 1 rating in computer player target evaluation. Must be > 0 to influence the computer player toward attacking the special type 1, < 0 to influence the computer player away from attacking the special type 1.

values.name: sn-special-attack-influence2
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the special attack type 2 rating in computer player target evaluation. Must be > 0 to influence the computer player toward attacking the special type 2, < 0 to influence the computer player away from attacking the special type 2.

values.name: sn-special-attack-influence3
values.available: seems available, except under standard victory conditions
values.notes: Sets the multiplier used for the special attack type 3 rating in computer player target evaluation. Must be > 0 to influence the computer player toward attacking the special type 3, < 0 to influence the computer player away from attacking the special type 3.

values.name: sn-minimum-water-body-size-for-dock
values.available: available, as long as the value will always be >= 300
values.notes: The minimum number of tiles (in surface area) that a body of water must be for a Dock to be placed on it.

values.name: sn-number-build-attempts-before-skip
values.notes: The maximum number of build attempts a build plan can go through before being put into skip mode.

values.name: sn-max-skips-per-attempt
values.notes: The maximum number of unbuilt items that can be skipped during any build plan processing before giving up (for being too far ahead of the current position in the plan).

values.name: sn-food-gatherer-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure food gatherers: foodGatherers = ( this + sn-food-modifier-percentage ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-gold-gatherer-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure gold gatherers: goldGatherers = ( this + sn-gold-modifier-percentage ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-stone-gatherer-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure stone gatherers: stoneGatherers = ( this + sn-stone-modifier-percentage ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-wood-gatherer-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure wood gatherers: woodGatherers = ( this + sn-wood-modifier-percentage ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-defend-important-group-leaders
values.notes: Controls whether or not important attack group leaders are defended by the other group units. A value of 1 has the members defend the leader. A value of 0 does not.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-continent
values.notes: Sets the additive value used for the targets on the same continent as the attack group commander. Must be > 0 to influence the computer player toward attacking the units on the same continent or 0 for no special influence.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-siege-weapon
values.notes: Sets the additive value used for influencing siege weapons to attack stationary targets (and influencing non-siege weapons not to attack those stationary targets). Must be > 0 to influence the computer player to use siege weapons to attack stationary targets or 0 for no special influence.

values.name: sn-tribute-amount
values.notes: Sets the required amount of gold that must be tributed to the computer player. If this is 0, no computer player tributing is monitored for the special system (thus, the normal tribute system is in effect). When this value is > 0, the computer player will expect some gold in tribute.

values.name: sn-tribute-chat-frequency
values.notes: Sets the frequency (in seconds) of the computer player's chat messages asking for tribute. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-tribute-chat-randomness
values.notes: Sets the randomness (in seconds) of the computer player's chat messages asking for tribute. Must be >= 0 and < sn-tribute-chat-frequency.

values.name: sn-tribute-timeout
values.notes: Sets the amount of time (in seconds) within which the tribute must take place. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-tribute-player
values.notes: Sets the player ID# of the player the computer player will target for the tribute request. Must be a valid player number for the game.

values.name: sn-tribute-success-outcome
values.notes: Controls what happens when the tribute request is fulfilled within the allotted time. If set to 0, nothing happens. If set to 1, the computer player will ally when the tribute amount is paid.

values.name: sn-tribute-failure-outcome
values.notes: Controls what happens when the tribute request is not fulfilled within the allotted time. If set to 0, nothing happens. If set to 1, the computer player will go to war when the tribute amount is not paid.

values.name: sn-group-leader-defense-distance
values.notes: Sets the defense distance for defenders of an important attack group leader.

values.name: sn-tribute-persistence
values.notes: Controls whether or not the interactive tribute system operates once or forever. A value of 1 makes it last the entire game (i.e. the computer player will continue to demand sn-tribute-amount of gold for the entire game, at intervals roughly equivalent to sn-tribute-chat-frequency from the outcome evaluation). A value of 0 makes the interactive tribute occur one time.

values.name: sn-tribute-revoke-on-attack
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player rescinds the favorable tribute outcome when the sn-tribute-player attacks the computer player. A value of 1 has the computer player rescind, a value of 0 does not.

values.name: sn-initial-attack-delay-type
values.notes: The type of initial attack delay. A value of 1 denotes a delay ended by the build list. A value of 2 uses the sn-initial-attack-delay timeout. A value of 3 allows the computer player to attack after he has been attacked by a non-Gaia player. A value of 0 allows any of the three occurrences to enable attacks.

values.name: sn-blot-exploration-map
values.available: available, but only later, as it greatly influences exploration
values.notes: This controls whether or not the computer player re-explores previously explored regions. A value of 1 has the computer player re-explore, a value of 0 does not.

values.name: sn-blot-size
values.available: available, but only later, as it greatly influences exploration
values.notes: This controls the size of the area that a computer player marks for re-exploration.

values.name: sn-add-starting-resource-food
values.notes: Cheat - adds extra food to starting resources.

values.name: sn-add-starting-resource-gold
values.notes: Cheat - adds extra gold to starting resources.

values.name: sn-add-starting-resource-stone
values.notes: Cheat - adds extra stone to starting resources.

values.name: sn-add-starting-resource-wood
values.notes: Cheat - adds extra wood to starting resources.

values.name: sn-intelligent-gathering
values.notes: Controls whether or not the intelligent gathering system is enabled.

values.name: sn-task-ungrouped-soldiers
values.notes: Controls whether or not ungrouped computer player soldiers get tasked to spread out and guard the computer player's general town area.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-boat
values.notes: Sets the additive value used for influencing land units to attack or not attack boats. Must be > 0 to influence land units to attack boats, 0 for no special influence, and less than 0 for aversion.

values.name: sn-number-enemy-objects-required
values.notes: The count of the number of enemy objects the computer player must see before dropping the number of civilian explorers down to the minimum level.

values.name: sn-most-needed-resource-look-ahead
values.notes: The number of build list objects the computer player will use to look ahead to tabulate the resources required. Only used for the dynamic gathering percentages. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-retask-gather-amount
values.notes: The minimum amount that a gatherer must gather before the computer player allows him to be retasked to another resource type. Some code may override this.

values.name: sn-max-retask-gather-amount
values.notes: The maximum amount that a gatherer can be told to gather before being allowed to be retasked. Some code may override this.

values.name: sn-max-storage-pits
values.notes: The maximum number of storage pits a computer player can build in one game. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-max-granaries
values.notes: The maximum number of granaries a computer player can build in one game. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-house-overage
values.notes: The number of Houses that a computer player will autobuild over the amount needed to support 50 units. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-build-plan-divisions
values.available: seems available
values.notes: The number of divisions a computer player will place in its build list (used to calculate gathering percentages). Must be >= 1.

values.name: sn-food-modifier-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure food gatherers: foodGatherers = ( sn-food-gatherer-percentage + this ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-wood-modifier-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure wood gatherers: woodGatherers = ( sn-wood-gatherer-percentage + this ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-stone-modifier-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure stone gatherers: stoneGatherers = ( sn-stone-gatherer-percentage + this ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-gold-modifier-percentage
values.notes: Set to configure gold gatherers: goldGatherers = ( sn-gold-gatherer-percentage + this ) * gathererTotal * 0.01 + 0.5.

values.name: sn-max-build-plan-gatherer-percentage
values.notes: The maximum percentage of gatherers that a computer player will task based on the pregame requirements of the build plan.

values.name: sn-required-first-building
values.notes: Controls what building a computer player must place first. 0: No restriction. 1: Either a Storage Pit or a granary. 2: A Storage Pit. 3: A Granary. 4: Both a Storage Pit and a Granary. Exceptions consist of a Town Center and sn-maximum-houses-before-dropsites.

values.name: sn-food-dropsite-distance
values.notes: The maximum number of tiles a computer player likes to walk to drop off its food.

values.name: sn-wood-dropsite-distance
values.notes: The maximum number of tiles a computer player likes to walk to drop off its wood.

values.name: sn-stone-dropsite-distance
values.notes: The maximum number of tiles a computer player likes to walk to drop off its stone.

values.name: sn-gold-dropsite-distance
values.notes: The maximum number of tiles a computer player likes to walk to drop off its gold.

values.name: sn-initial-exploration-required
values.notes: The percentage of the map that must be explored by a computer player before any building is allowed.

values.name: sn-random-placement-factor
values.notes: A number that gets added into the placement of the computer player to randomize building placement (off of the calculated ideal).

values.name: sn-required-forest-tiles
values.notes: The minimum number of forest tiles that a computer player must uncover before placing its first lumber camp.

values.name: sn-minimum-food
values.notes: The minimum amount of food a computer player likes to keep on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-minimum-wood
values.notes: The minimum amount of wood a computer player likes to keep on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-minimum-stone
values.notes: The minimum amount of stone a computer player likes to keep on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-minimum-gold
values.notes: The minimum amount of gold a computer player likes to keep on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-maximum-houses-before-dropsites
values.notes: The maximum number of Houses that can be built before a dropsite is built. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-specific-build-item-to-build
values.available: seems available
values.notes: A specific build item that should be inserted into the computer player's list. Must be a valid building ID.

values.name: sn-specific-build-item-time
values.available: seems available
values.notes: The time (in minutes) that the sn-specific-build-item-to-build should be inserted into. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-unskippable-item-type
values.available: seems available
values.notes: Allows the computer player to not skip a particular item type during building. Must be a valid building ID.

values.name: sn-attack-diplomacy-impact
values.available: available, except for when teams-locked is disabled
values.notes: The impact (positive or negative) that a computer player injects into his diplomacy system when attacked.

values.name: sn-percent-half-exploration
values.notes: The percentage of map exploration that allows the computer player to task down to half the number of explorers.

values.name: sn-auto-build-houses
values.notes: Controls whether the computer player can decide to build its houses by itself. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-upgrade-to-tool-age-asap
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player will abandon all to upgrade to the Tool Age as soon as it becomes available for research. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-upgrade-to-bronze-age-asap
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player will abandon all to upgrade to the Bronze Age as soon as it becomes available for research. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-upgrade-to-iron-age-asap
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player will abandon all to upgrade to the Iron Age as soon as it becomes available for research. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-time-kill-ratio
values.notes: The amount of influence the time to kill a target has in deciding what to attack.

values.name: sn-target-evaluation-in-progress
values.notes: The amount of influence of continuing to attack a target already under attack.

values.name: sn-coop-demand-tribute-interval
values.notes: Controls how often the computer player may demand tribute from his computer player allies (in seconds). Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-coop-demand-tribute-maximum
values.notes: Controls the maximum amount a computer player may demand from his computer player allies at any one time. Must be >= 1.

values.name: sn-attack-winning-player
values.available: available, but only for 1v1 and Wonder Race games
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player will attack the winning player (if there is more than one to choose from).

values.name: sn-maximum-food
values.notes: Controls the maximum amount of food the computer player likes to have on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-maximum-wood
values.notes: Controls the maximum amount of wood the computer player likes to have on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-maximum-stone
values.notes: Controls the maximum amount of stone the computer player likes to have on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-maximum-gold
values.notes: Controls the maximum amount of gold the computer player likes to have on hand. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-coop-share-information
values.notes: Controls whether or not allied computer players share information about what they uncover (this is not like Cartography; instead, it's analogous to two humans chatting).

values.name: sn-attack-winning-player-factor
values.available: available, but only for 1v1 and Wonder Race games
values.notes: The influence the sn-attack-winning-player will have on deciding who to attack if it's set to 1.

values.name: sn-coop-share-attacking
values.available: seems available, but only for 1v1 and Wonder Race games
values.notes: Controls whether allied computer players can attack to defend each other.

values.name: sn-coop-share-attacking-interval
values.available: seems available, but only for 1v1 and Wonder Race games
values.notes: Controls how often this computer player can ask another for help (in seconds).

values.name: sn-percentage-explore-exterminators
values.notes: Determines how many of the computer player's soldier explore groups are set as extermination groups. Must be >= 0 and <= 100.

values.name: sn-track-player-history
values.notes: Decides whether or not a human player's tendencies are tracked or not.

values.name: sn-minimum-dropsite-buffer
values.notes: Controls how far away a computer player will keep dropsites in relation to enemy town centers.

values.name: sn-use-by-type-max-gathering
values.notes: Controls whether or not logical, type-specific gatherer requirements are placed on the quantity of resources gatherers must collect before being allowed to be retasked.

values.name: sn-minimum-boar-hunt-group-size
values.notes: The number of villagers a computer player must collect before allowing boars to be hunted for food.

values.name: sn-auto-build-dropsites
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player decides how and when to build storage pits and granaries. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-auto-build-farms
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player can use extra wood to build Farms once all of the build list buildings are constructed. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-auto-build-towers
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player can use extra stone to build towers. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-auto-build-docks
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player decides how and when to build Docks. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-auto-build-fishing-boats
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player decides how and when to build fishing boats. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-auto-build-transports
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player decides how and when to build transports. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-desired-number-docks
values.notes: How many Docks the computer player wants in a given game. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-desired-number-fishing-boats
values.notes: How many fishing boats the computer player wants in a given game. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-desired-number-transports
values.notes: How many transports the computer player wants in a given game. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-allow-diplomacy-change-on-ally-attack
values.available: seems available, except for when teams-locked is disabled
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player can change his alliance when attacked by an ally. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-minimum-amount-for-trading
values.notes: Controls how much of a resource a computer player must have before using it for trading.

values.name: sn-allow-diplomacy-change-on-tribute
values.available: seems available, except for when teams-locked is disabled
values.notes: Controls whether or not the computer player will allow his diplomacy to change when he receives tribute from a player. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-easiest-reaction-percentage
values.notes: Sets the effective reaction percentage (of normal LOS) a computer player unit will use in single-player Easiest level scenario or campaign games.

values.name: sn-easier-reaction-percentage
values.notes: Sets the effective reaction percentage (of normal LOS) a computer player unit will use in single-player easier scenario or campaign games.

values.name: sn-max-farms
values.notes: Caps the number of Farms a computer player will build. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-hits-before-alliance-change
values.available: available, except for when teams-locked is disabled
values.notes: Sets the number of times a computer player will allow his units to be hit by an ally before allowing his diplomacy to be changed.

values.name: sn-max-towers
values.available: seems available
values.notes: Caps the number of towers a computer player will build. Must be >= 0. Starts at 0, changed to 10 after some time has elapsed.

values.name: sn-auto-build-warships
values.notes: Determines if the computer player is allowed to decide how and when to build warships. Must be 0 or 1.

values.name: sn-desired-number-warships
values.notes: How many warships the computer player wants in a given game. Must be >= 0.

values.name: sn-allow-civilian-defense
values.notes: Set to 0 to disable civilian defense, 1 to defend against weak, non-ranged units, 2 for all weak units except warships and units faster than villagers, and 3 for all weak units except warships.

values.name: sn-number-forward-builders
values.notes: The number of villagers a computer player uses to build outside of an enemy town. Forward builders refer specifically to those villagers that must board a Transport to cross over water that cannot otherwise be pathed, either because players are on islands, or because other forms of access have been walled-off. It is not necessary to specify forward builders, unless the villagers need to board a Transport.

values.name: sn-percent-attack-soldiers
values.notes: Sets the percentage of defense soldiers that will be sent into battle (modified for difficulty level) the next time attack-now is issued. All newly created soldiers are defense soldiers by default, and will remain defense soldiers until attack-now is issued. For example, if 10 soldiers were defending a town, and sn-percent-attack-soldiers was set to 50, then 5 soldiers will form an attack group and attack. This SN only needs to be set once, but it can be changed as needed. sn-percent-attack-soldiers works best when not using sn-number-defend-groups.

values.name: sn-percent-attack-boats
values.notes: Sets the percentage of defense boats that will be sent into battle (modified for difficulty level) the next time attack-now is issued. All newly created boats are defense boats by default, and will remain defense boats until attack-now is issued. Both attack soldiers and attack boats will attack when attack-now is issued. This SN only needs to be set once, but it can be changed as needed.

values.name: sn-do-not-scale-for-difficulty-level
values.notes: Disables the automatic difficulty-scaling. See Level of Difficulty - Random Map Game. Default = 0.

values.name: sn-group-form-distance
values.notes: Sets the distance over which attack soldiers will group. Set this value high if buildings that train military units are far apart.

values.name: sn-ignore-attack-group-under-attack
values.notes: Set to 1 to specify that defensive units should ignore attack groups under attack.

values.name: sn-gather-defense-units
values.notes: Set to 1 to send units to defend buildings under construction.

values.name: sn-maximum-wood-drop-distance
values.notes: The parameters control how far from a dropsite a given resource type can be before the CP ignores it. -1 indicates a "don't care" -- i.e. it can be any distance (as it used to be).

values.name: sn-maximum-food-drop-distance
values.notes: The parameters control how far from a dropsite a given resource type can be before the CP ignores it. -1 indicates a "don't care" -- i.e. it can be any distance (as it used to be).

values.name: sn-maximum-hunt-drop-distance
values.notes: The parameters control how far from a dropsite a given resource type can be before the CP ignores it. -1 indicates a "don't care" -- i.e. it can be any distance (as it used to be).

values.name: sn-maximum-fish-boat-drop-distance
values.available: available, except for water maps, however if the value will always be large enough, it should be fine
values.notes: The parameters control how far from a dropsite a given resource type can be before the CP ignores it. -1 indicates a "don't care" -- i.e. it can be any distance (as it used to be). If set to 0, all fishing ships will explore the water.

values.name: sn-maximum-gold-drop-distance
values.notes: The parameters control how far from a dropsite a given resource type can be before the CP ignores it. -1 indicates a "don't care" -- i.e. it can be any distance (as it used to be).

values.name: sn-maximum-stone-drop-distance
values.notes: The parameters control how far from a dropsite a given resource type can be before the CP ignores it. -1 indicates a "don't care" -- i.e. it can be any distance (as it used to be). By setting the parameters to the appropriate value it is possible to avoid having villagers walk all over the map to gather resources.

values.name: sn-gather-idle-soldiers-at-center
values.notes: When set to 1, it will "move" the town defense gather point to the "center" (randomized +-6 tiles) of the map. No provision is made if the center is in an unreachable spot. When it's set, all idle and retreating units will try to go to the center. Useful for King of the Hill and similar variants to get the CP to group near the middle.

values.name: sn-garrison-rams
values.available: available, if you will not create rams
values.notes: Set to 0 to turn off. When on, the CP AI tries (but doesn't always succeed) to put infantry units into rams before the attack group departs.

values.name: sn-do-not-transport-from-same-zone
values.available: available, except for water maps requiring transport ships
values.notes: Set to 1 to influence transport ship behavior.

values.name: sn-enable-new-building-system
values.notes: Set to 1 only once to request the new building system, featuring simultaneous construction and cancellation control.

values.name: sn-percent-building-cancellation
values.notes: Set to the maximum allowable completion percentage for building cancellation.

values.name: sn-enable-boar-hunting
values.notes: Set to 1 to target deer and boar; if it's set to 2, deer will be ignored.

values.name: sn-minimum-number-hunters
values.notes: Set to force hunting. For best results when hunting boar, set this in conjunction with sn-minimum-boar-hunt-group-size.

values.name: sn-object-repair-level
values.notes: Add bit flags together to generate a value: 0 = wonder; 1 = castle, monastery; 2 = town-center; 4 = barracks; 8 = archery-range; 16 = stable; 32 = siege-workshop; 64 = dock; 128 = market; 256 = university; 512 = blacksmith; 1024 = lumber-camp, mining-camp, mill; 2048 = house; 4096 = towers; 8192 = walls and gates; 16384 = siege weapons. For scenarios and campaigns, the default is 1 for compatibility.

values.name: sn-enable-patrol-attack
values.notes: Set to 1 to enable the patrol-style local targeting system. When attacking a distant target, this causes units to retarget against nearby sighted units immediately instead of waiting until they are in proximity to the original target.

values.name: sn-dropsite-separation-distance
values.notes: Set to suggest the minimum distance between dropsites. Higher values can be useful for an escape camp when gatherers are under attack.

values.name: sn-target-player-number
values.notes: Set to the number of the player that should be targeted for attack. If this sn is set to -1, initiating an attack will instead provide assistance to allies. When set to 0, sn-attack-winning-player will determine the target. Setting this to a player that cannot be attacked (an ally or the AI itself) will result in undefined behavior. You can also use this value with the "target-player" identifier in facts and actions.

values.name: sn-safe-town-size
values.notes: If an enemy building is inside both sn-maximum-town-size and the region specified by this sn, it will be targeted by defensive units. If the building is inside sn-maximum-town-size, but outside this region, it will be targeted only if it belongs to the player specified by sn-target-player-number.

values.name: sn-focus-player-number
values.notes: Set to any player number in order to use the "focus-player" identifier in facts and actions.

values.name: sn-minimum-boar-lure-group-size
values.notes: Set to the number of villagers that will be sent in the initial boar luring group.

values.name: sn-preferred-mill-placement
values.notes: Set to 0 for forage, 1 for deer, or 2 for shore fish.

values.name: sn-enable-offensive-priority
values.notes: Set to 1 to enable attack-now and attack groups to target using the priorities set by up-set-offense-priority.

values.name: sn-building-targeting-mode
values.notes: Set to 0 to target all buildings, 1 to ignore walls and gates, or 2 to ignore walls, gates, and dropsites. Please avoid this strategic number, as you may experience targeting failures under certain circumstances.

values.name: sn-home-exploration-time
values.notes: Set to the maximum amount of time, in seconds, that should be dedicated to exploring the home town center region.

values.name: sn-number-civilian-militia
values.notes: Set to the maximum number of villagers who may be used to attack the enemy.

values.name: sn-allow-civilian-offense
values.notes: Set to 1 to allow villagers to participate as soldiers in town-size attacks. If set to 2, villagers will target enemy villagers and buildings even if defensive military units are available. If set to 0, villagers will only be sent to attack enemy forward towers, without murder holes.

values.name: sn-preferred-trade-distance
values.notes: Set to the preferred distance between local and remote trade buildings.

values.name: sn-lumber-camp-max-distance
values.notes: Sets the maximum-town-size for lumber-camp placement, when non-zero. If set to 0, sn-camp-max-distance will be used instead.

values.name: sn-mining-camp-max-distance
values.notes: Sets the maximum-town-size for mining-camp placement, when non-zero. If set to 0, sn-camp-max-distance will be used instead.

values.name: sn-wall-targeting-mode
values.notes: Set to 1 to allow military units to automatically target nearby walls and gates. If set to 0, they will likely be ignored.

values.name: sn-livestock-to-town-center
values.notes: Set to 1 to require livestock, such as sheep, to gather at the town center. If set to 0, they will gather at mills, as well.

values.name: sn-enable-training-queue
values.notes: Set to 1 to allow an additional unit to be queued at each building. If set to 0, buildings will train one unit at a time.

values.name: sn-ignore-tower-elevation
values.notes: Set to 1 to ignore elevation when placing towers. If set to 0, the AI will try to seek elevation advantage.

values.name: sn-town-center-placement
values.notes: Set to the building type to emulate for town center placement. If set to 0, the town center will be placed as usual.

values.name: sn-disable-tower-priority
values.notes: Set to 1 to prevent the local targeting system from giving special priority to towers and other fortifications, including town centers and castles. If set to 0, these buildings will receive the usual special priority.

values.name: sn-placement-zone-size
values.notes: Set to the size of the tile zone used for forward and controlled building placement. All build commands store this value and the up-set-placement-data information with each successful call. For every pass that a building cannot be placed, its zone size will be increased from this starting point.

values.name: sn-placement-fail-delta
values.notes: Set to the value that will be added to the placement distance set by up-set-placement-data for every pass that a building cannot be placed.

values.name: sn-placement-to-center
values.notes: Set to 1 to force place-control to use the map center as the second point of reference for placement. The first point of reference is set with up-set-placement-data. If set to 0, the active target enemy's nearest building will become the second point of reference instead, once discovered. If sn-target-player-number is 0, the target enemy will be determined by sn-attack-winning-player.

values.name: sn-disable-attack-groups
values.notes: Set to 1 to disable automatic attack group targeting. Once groups are created, they can be used for defensive attack purposes using TSA. If set to 0, attack groups will perform offensive targeting as usual.

values.name: sn-allow-adjacent-dropsites
values.notes: Set to 1 to eliminate the standard requirement for a 1 tile buffer around mills, lumber camps, and mining camps. If set to 0, the 1 tile buffer is enforced as usual.

values.name: sn-defer-dropsite-update
values.notes: Set to 1 to defer the dropsite-min-distance update until construction is complete. If set to 0, the dropsite update occurs when the building is placed on the map.

values.name: sn-maximum-garrison-fill
values.notes: Set to the number of units to fill into each garrison target per command. If set to 0, this limit is removed.

values.name: sn-number-garrison-units
values.notes: Set to the number of units that will garrison per command. If set to 0, it will default to the maximum of 40.

values.name: sn-filter-under-attack
values.notes: Set to 1 or 2 to filter retreat commands to only those units that are under attack. When this is 2, units near threatened units will also be retreated, which may be computationally expensive. If set to 0, the filter is disabled.

values.name: sn-disable-defend-groups
values.notes: Append flags to disable various defense systems: 1 to disable the defensive (TSA) targeting system, 2 to disable assistance inside sn-safe-town-size, 4 to disable assistance between sn-safe-town-size and sn-maximum-town-size, 8 to disable assistance outside sn-maximum-town-size. When assistance is disabled, please be aware that your units will only respond to attackers within their individual line of sight. If set to 0, units will respond to threats in town as usual.

values.name: sn-dock-placement-mode
values.notes: Set to 1 to prefer placement toward the front, -1 to prefer placement toward the back, or 0 for standard placement.

values.name: sn-dock-proximity-factor
values.notes: Set to the proximity factor for docks to be placed relative to one another. Positive values prefer more distance, while negative values prefer less distance.

values.name: sn-dock-avoidance-factor
values.notes: Set to the avoidance factor for docks in the same zone (body of water). Positive values avoid placement in the same zone, while negative values prefer it.

values.name: sn-dock-training-filter
values.notes: Set to 1 or 2 to enable the intelligent dock training filter. This will prevent docks from training ships that would likely be useless in their body of water. If set to 1, docks will continue to train in seas that no longer contain recently sighted targets, while 2 will block training. If set to 0, docks will train units without additional consideration.

values.name: sn-free-siege-targeting
values.notes: Add bit flags together to generate a value: 1 = trebuchet; 2 = cannon-galleon. Set a flag for a unit to enable free offensive targeting with attack-now or attack groups. This may result in the targeting of units other than buildings. If set to 0, non-buildings will be ignored unless units must respond due to sn-enemy-sighted-response-distance.

values.name: sn-warship-targeting-mode
values.notes: Set to 1 to cause warships to target based on the unit with the shortest range in the group against fortifications. Set to 2 to eliminate the range check. If set to 0, warship groups will target based on the unit with the longest range.

values.name: sn-disable-sighted-response-cap
values.notes: Set to 1 to eliminate the cap of 50 on sn-enemy-sighted-response-distance. If set to 0, the cap will remain in effect for changes to sn-enemy-sighted-response-distance.

values.name: sn-disable-builder-assistance
values.notes: Set to 1 to prevent builders from assisting on nearby foundations after their work is complete. If set to 0, they will assist as usual.

values.name: sn-local-targeting-mode
values.notes: Set to 1 to prioritize attack bonuses and overall damage per hit. If set to 2, units will prioritize targets with high base pierce armor, such as rams; otherwise, they will target as usual. The offensive priority value of a target (-1 to 11) is added to the weight for modes 1 and 2, as well. If set to 0, units will target as usual.

values.name: sn-livestock-defend-priority
values.notes: Set to 1 to allow sheep into the targetable sighted objects list.

values.name: sn-number-tasked-units
values.notes: Set to the number of units to require per group tasked by up-target-objects or up-target-point. The last group sent by a command may not reach the minimum required number. It's possible that no units will be sent to some of the last remote targets. If set to 0, units will be spread in order to ensure balanced group sizes to all remote targets.

values.name: sn-disable-villager-garrison
values.notes: Set to 3 to prevent villagers from auto-garrisoning for any reason. If set to 2, gaia is ignored and villagers will only garrison for enemy attacks if they can enter a town center. If set to 1, gaia is ignored and villagers will garrison for any enemy attacks. If set to 0, villagers will garrison as usual.

values.name: sn-target-point-adjustment
values.notes: Set to adjust the tile positioning of up-target-point toward 1:left, 2:top, 3:right, 4:bottom, 5:middle, 6:precise. If set to 0, actions will be directed to the absolute left-most point of a tile. If set to precise, you must directly pass a valid precise point goal pair (point x100 for precision) to up-target-point.

values.name: sn-unexplored-construction
values.notes: Set to 1 to allow the AI to construct buildings on unexplored tiles. If set to 0, the AI will have to directly explore tiles in order to build there as usual. Please do not enable this without #load-if-not-defined REVEAL-NORMAL.

values.name: sn-disable-trade-evasion
values.notes: Set to 1 to prevent trade carts from abandoning their gold and trade route in order to evade attackers. If set to 0, trade carts will attempt to evade attackers as usual.

values.name: sn-boar-lure-destination
values.notes: Set to a value from this image to adjust the boar lure destination at the town center. Add 12 to the normal value (0 to 11) to shift the point down to the grid corner. If set to 0, lurers will attempt to reach the center tile of the town center.
